Who am I?

My name is Fares Alaboud. I’m a first-year computer science student at King’s College London. I’m active, outgoing, talkative and do my best to be helpful around others. I try to be very involved in my course and around campus. I tend to be found at tech events such as hackathons and talks, lectures or workshops.

Events I'm attending soon:

  • StudentHack And it was EPIC. I’ll have a blog post up soon!
  • HackKings, the UK’s largest student-run university hackathon
  • StartupWeekend

The list of things I enjoy include:

Reading
As long as the book I’m reading is not on my course syllabus.

Attending the theatre
I’ve attended Mamma Mia and Wicked. I’ve enjoyed both, very greatly, but unfortunately never get the opportunity to attend more plays.

Baking
I’m even part of my university’s baking society. I bake all kinds of desserts: from cookies to cheesecakes. My specialty is brownies.

Watching movies/going to the cinema
I’m a fanatic of sci-fi movies. My favourite movie series is The Hunger Games (call me cliche) and my all-time-favourite is Tim Burton’s Sweeney Todd.

Learning new programming languages
I’m currently refreshing my memory on HTML, and I’m learning JavaScript & Python. Next up is jQuery, then PHP and Ruby. You can track my progress on my Codecademy profile. I’m also currently doing an online Stanford University course on developing iOS applications for iPhone and iPad. I’m hoping to be done with that by March.

Attending hackathons and tech-related events
I’ve attended StartupWeekend, and you can see a video of me at the event. I am the first person and last person who talks in the video. I’ve also got three more on my list:, HackKings and another StartupWeekend event in April.

Traveling
One of the things I enjoy the most: traveling around the world making friends and visiting new places.

Wanna get in touch? Drop me a message via email or contact me using one of the links on the left!

Feel free to copy me.
